answers.answer: Hi!The numbness could be due to nerve compression. This is possible at various levels. It could be due to compression of the spinal nerves at the cervical spine level or, ulnar nerve at the elbow level or even at the wrist. Once a nerve is compressed, it can cause pain or numbness anywhere along its path.  Hypothyroidism, diabetes, tumors and infections of the ulnar and spinal nerves and rheumatism can all cause numbness of little and ring finger. In your case the possible site of pinched nerve could be the elbow because of distal bicep tear. Please consult a neurologist. Take care!

question: Last night I became a victim of a Distal Bicep tear in my left arm and this morning I'm experiencing numbness and tingling in my pinky & ring finger in my left. What is causing this?
title: Numbness after Distal Bicep tear
